intro: Draba porsildii, commonly known as Porsild's whitlow grass, is a small flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of northern Scandinavia and northern Russia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in a cluster at the top of its slender stem. Draba porsildii typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. It is a perennial species that thrives in low-nutrient conditions and is often found in tundra and mountainous areas.
